newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil Cenbank alters forex reserve requirements.
newsitem.headline: Brazil Cenbank alters forex reserve requirements.

text.p: Brazil's Central Bank said beginning Friday it would require banks engaging in foreign exchange operations to make reserve requirement deposits on a daily rather than weekly basis.
Jose Maria Carvalho, head of the Central Bank's forex department, said the move would help the bank monitor dollar inflows.
In addition, the Central Bank would be replacing its existing paperwork monitoring system with an automated one, Carvalho said.
"This does not alter the system in any substantial way," he said.

He said the new measure accompanies restrictions adopted in March to restrict import financing. That move, the bank said, was aimed more at eliminating forex arbitrage opportunities available to importers than restricting imports.
Since March, the government has adopted a series of measures to slow Brazil's growing trade gap in a bid to improve a current account balance of payments deficit.
The current account gap is expected to surge toward the $35 billion level this year from $24 billion in 1996.
